list.event: Breaking of the Fellowship. Boromir slain. Pippin and Merry captured by orcs. Aragorn, Legolas and Gimli return to Parth Galen. Lay Boromir in one of the boats and send it over Rauros Falls. Seeing that Sam and Frodo have gone east, Aragorn chooses to rescue Merry and Pippin.
The ‘Three Hunters’ return to the glade where Boromir fell and pick up the orcs’ trail (ca. 4:30 p.m.)
Trail passes along many gullies and ravines which dissect the backslope of the eastern ridge of the Emyn Muil
Descend the steep western cliff face
Rest briefly about an hour before dawn (ca. 5 a.m.). No Camp
They are in a stony trough between ridged hills. A trickling stream runs through the trough. Aragorn cannot see the trail in the stony land, but decides to look north
Legolas finds 5 dead orcs. They search area
Aragorn finds orcs’ pathway going up a ravine in the western ridge. The upper stream runs in the ravine
Head of the stream. They continue up the ravine
Reach crest of western ridge. Dawn. Chill wind. Legolas sees eagle. Also sees the orc company far ahead (ca. 36 miles)
Trail goes north along ridge
Reach a narrow ravine where orcs climbed down. A noisy stream runs through it. The cliff drops ‘20 fathoms’ (120 feet) to a ‘wide and rugged shelf’ – the East Wall of Rohan
The sheer cliff drops to the grassy plains on a path like a stony stair
Stream disappears amid watercress. Air is warm and fragrant. They run faster
Aragorn sees Pippin’s trail to the side and finds the Elven brooch
Brief rest
Brief rest
Night falls. Camp (ca. 5:30 p.m.)
Aragorn listens to ground and hears horses galloping away from them. They leave at dawn
Ground begins to rise toward the downs to the north (ca. 3 p.m.)
Trail bends north. Tracks become more faint on the dryer ground. Land seems empty
Camp. Legolas fears orcs have reached Fangorn. Gathering clouds hide sliver of moon
A red dawn. East wind.
11 a.m. Reach the first slopes of the Downs. See trampled grass from the orc camp just west of the slope. Aragorn estimates 36 hours old
North face of southern down ridge
Rising crest of second down ridge
Reach most northerly hill of the Downs. Camp on hill. Cold and starry

Dawn – east wind. Can see the Wold ahead and to the east. 15 miles away they see the Riders of Rohan. Decide to wait there. Meeting with the Riders. Éomer lends them two horses. Aragorn rides Hasufel; Legolas and Gimli: Arod. Leave ca. 11 a.m
Find the orc trail from the East. Aragorn searches. Ride more slowly
Overcast. Begin to find dead orcs
Reach Fangorn and find pyre of orcs (ca. 4 p.m.). Search area. Camp by trees. Build a fire. See Saruman. Horses flee, but meet Shadowfax
Eat at dawn. Search again
Find mallorn leaf near knife and ropes
See faint hobbit prints near river
See prints of 1 hobbit at edge of trees. Enter Fangorn Forest
Clear prints by river of both Merry and Pippin (2 days old)
Follow hobbits’ trail to foot of Treebeard’s Hill
Climb Treebeard’s Hill. See old man below. Legolas realizes it is Gandalf!
Leave Treebeard’s Hill
Follow the Entwash back out of the forest. Gandalf whistles for Shadowfax. Arod and Hasufel also return
Go along bank of the Entwash
Wade across the river at a shallow place
Flat land, treeless and wide. Ride through meads and riverlands
Hidden pool
Sedge in treacherous bogs
As sun settles toward the west, see smoke from Isengard
Sunset
Dusk
Full night
Shadowfax leads as quickly as by daylight
Stop at last (ca. midnight). Camp only a few hours
Continue under the moon (ca. 3 a.m.). Long clouds and chill wind
Moon sets into clouds of the west
Bitter chill. Dark slowly fades
Dawn. Clear and bright. Legolas can see Meduseld
Ford the Snowbourne. Reach a wide track. Follow it to the uplands
Pass the burial mounds at the foot of the hill and climb to Edoras. Stopped from entering until permission is received

Climb to Meduseld, the Golden Hall of Edoras. Gandalf heals Théoden. Rainy and windy as they exit the hall, but a shaft of sunlight shines through. Éomer is freed. Grima departs. King orders Riders to prepare to ride. Eat. Leave ca. 1 p.m
Recross the Snowbourne
Follow a beaten way across the foothills
Cross a small stream
Dusk. Camp (ca. 6 p.m.)
Rise at dawn. Depart ca. 7 a.m
Cross a small stream
No clouds, but hot and hazy. Dark in the east
Cross a small stream
Legolas can see darkness with shapes in it near the River Isen: Huorns
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream
Cross a small stream
Dark clouds from east begin to overtake them
Sunset. Near the mouth of the Westfold Vale. See a ride in the west
Rider arrives. Tells them of the fall of Erkenbrand. Gandalf advises Théoden to ride for Helm’s Deep. Gandalf leaves on Shadowfax
Host reaches the road into the Deeping Coomb. They turn south
Night falls
As climb upwards in the Deeping Coomb, scout reports wolf-riders
Orc bands flee the advancing Riders
Looking back, see torches of Saruman’s army
Reach Helm’s Dike. It is overcast and dark
Reach the Hornburg: the fortress of Helm’s Deep

Past midnight. Lightning shows all the vale is filled with Saruman’s army – 10,000 strong at least. Rain begins. Battle of Helm’s Deep. Weather clears (ca. 4:30 a.m.). Uruk-hai blast an opening through the Deeping Wall. Defenders retreat to the Hornburg and the caves.DAWN. Defenders counterattack. Gandalf arrives with Erkenbrand’s riders. Orcs flee into Huorns and are destroyed. Dunlendings surrender. King’s company rests. Departs for Isengard in afternoon (ca. 3 p.m.)
Company stops at burial mounds, then passes through Helm’s Dike
Reach Huorns. Road continues among the ‘trees.’
Reach the end of the Huorns.
Turn west to Fords of Isen. Red after-sunset. See carrion fowl ahead
Waxing moon rises
Reach Fords (ca. 9:30 p.m.). The Isen is almost dry. Pass the burial mound of Erkenbrand’s riders on an islet in the riverbed
Turn north on the highway to Isengard
Midnight. 15 miles north of the Fords. Camp beside the river. During the night Huorns pass by. Company wakes. Later the water returns
Dawn. Make ready to continue. Ride slowly
Enter the south end of the Wizard’s Vale
Pass through a wilderness of weeds and thorns. All trees cut to stumps
Highway becomes a wide street, paved with stones
Pass a tall pillar: the White Hand. Evidence of a flood beyond
Reach the gates of Isengard (past noon). Meet Merry and Pippin. Aragorn, Legolas and Gimli stay at gatehouse to eat and talk
Reach Orthanc. Confrontation with Saruman
